snippet.title: Open homes to see this weekend in Sydney
snippet.content:
An elegant redesign in , a 1920s heritage home in Newtown and a sunny north-facing apartment in all make Domain's property wish-list this week.
Ryde
An elegant redesign has transformed this cottage into a modern classic. A stone island is the hero of the kitchen-living area, which opens to a covered deck and lawn. The main bedroom plus study alcove take up the whole second storey. Meadowbank Public School is 100 metres away; ferry and train services are also close by. Agents and of will take the property to auction on August 19 with a guide of $1.85 million.
The Ryde property has had an extensive renovation. Photo: Supplied
Newtown
8 Hawken Street, Newtown. Photo: Supplied Between two train stations and with a primary school at the end of the street, this freestanding cottage is designed thoughtfully for rest and recreation. The cherished hallmarks of its pre-1920s heritage shine through a sleek renovation with indoor-outdoor living and designer touches.
The open-plan living space leads to a paved outdoor area. Photo: Supplied and of will take the property to auction on August 19.
Darlinghurst
509/50 Burton Street, Darlinghurst. Photo: Supplied The iconic Republic II building by architects is known for its edgy urban design, walk-to-anywhere location and hipster-magnet properties. This north-facing apartment has a two-storey glass wall to soak in the city atmosphere and a balcony overlooking the pool and the city skyline. A guide of $1.7 million has been set for the August 12 auction. of has the listing.
The communal outdoor area has a water feature and looks out to Sydney's CBD. Photo: Supplied
Download the Domain app to search for properties open for inspection this Saturday near you
The story first appeared on .
